abstract: Merrill Lynch, the big investment bank being acquired by Bank of America, on Thursday reported a $5.2 billion loss as it continued to take deep markdowns on the value of its assets. The red ink was more than twice as deep as a year ago, when Merrill reported a $2.2 billion net loss.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch, the big investment bank being acquired by Bank of America, on Thursday reported a $5.2 billion loss as it continued to take deep markdowns on the value of its assets. The red ink was more than twice as deep as a year ago, when Merrill reported a $2.2 billion net loss.

abstract: Merrill Lynch, the investment bank that sold itself to Bank of America last month, reported a third-quarter loss on Thursday of $5.1 billion, or $5.56 a share.
snippet: Merrill Lynch, the investment bank that sold itself to Bank of America last month, reported a third-quarter loss on Thursday of $5.1 billion, or $5.56 a share.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch, the investment bank that sold itself to Bank of America last month, reported a third-quarter loss on Thursday of $5.1 billion, or $5.56 a share.

headline.main: Merrill Reports Its Fifth Quarterly Loss
headline.print_headline: Merrill Reports Its Fifth Quarterly Loss

abstract: Merrill Lynch reported its earnings Thursday, possibly for the last time as an independent company. On a conference call that was notable mostly for its lack of fireworks, John Thain, Merrill’s chief executive, said he was “optimistic” about the firm’s future as it moved to consummate its merger with Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch reported its earnings Thursday, possibly for the last time as an independent company. On a conference call that was notable mostly for its lack of fireworks, John Thain, Merrill’s chief executive, said he was “optimistic” about the firm’s future as it moved to consummate its merger with Bank of America.
